content: anyway you want it yaya lovestoknit june 29 2023 anyway you want it is a knit beanie that begins with a simple k2p2 ribbed band followed by 21 rounds of stranded knitting actually only 19 rounds … the first and last charted rounds are just knit stitches then the remainder of the hat is plain knit with decreases for the crown like most knitters i accumulate lots of leftover balls of yarn the 4 versions of anyway you want it shown here were knit using leftover balls of 100% superwash wool in different color combinations while i used 100% superwash wool feel free to use other yarns you have left from projects use as many colors as you have available or as few as you want follow the whole chart or just the parts of the chart you like the best anyway you want it song of the day anyway you want it by journey 1980 https //youtu be/atxuulducfi size adult on average the sample hats measure 8½ from top to bottom and 15½ around the bottom band unstretched there is enough ease to fit an adult size head comfortably yarn worsted weight i suggest having at least a total of 115 to 120 yards available because this is a scrappy project adjustments are easily made by adding another leftover ball remember you can use as many colors as you have available needles us 06 circular needles plus us 06 double pointed needles other tools stitch marker s tapestry/darning needle gauge 20 sts x 28 rnds = 4 square abbreviations used k= knit k2tog = knit two stitches together p = purl round = round s st s = stitch es 1 | p a ge begin pattern using the circular needle cast on 104 sts taking care to not twist the stitches place the stitch marker to indicate the beginning of round and join to begin knitting in the round bottom band k2 p2 for ribbing repeat until band measures 1½
